description.value:
Professional warriors, guards, or gladiators. Fighters hone their martial skill above all other classes. They use a variety of weapons and can push their bodies further than others.

The following is a revision of the 5e fighter class. It is meant to rebalance fighting styles and improve the fighter's ability to make saves at mid to high levels. Existing 5e subclasses will all work mechanically with this form of the fighter class. Click @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.VLxJ80DY7q7hkXU7.JournalEntryPage.QjLATbZ1uI3tAwjs#fighter]{here} for a summary of changes.

Level 1 Fighters

When you create a level 1 Fighter, you will need to manually add your ability scores. You will gain the rest of the following automatically:

Recommended Ability Scores

You can take one of these recommended ability score arrays, or you can roll or assign them yourself. You can switch any two ability scores, but you do not add any further bonuses (they're already included).

&reference[Strength]: 16   &reference[Dexterity]: 12 &reference[Constitution]: 16   &reference[Intelligence]: 8 &reference[Wisdom]: 12   &reference[Charisma]: 11 

or

Strength: 12   Dexterity: 16   Constitution: 14   Intelligence: 10  Wisdom: 12   Charisma: 12  

Feat

You gain a level 1 @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.lGAvinVvDjAXzQ1Q]{feat} of your choice. You can choose from the feats available to all classes or choose a level 1 class-specific feat, if there is one available.​

Hit Points

Hit Points at 1st Level: 10 + Constitution Modifier
Hit Points at Higher Levels: 1d10 (or 6) + Constitution Modifier
Hit Dice: 1d10 per fighter level

Proficiencies

@UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.q10XUuFrVlw8qYj1]{Armor}: @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.q10XUuFrVlw8qYj1.JournalEntryPage.4ZoOlPhNDk46Vvnr]{Light Armor}, @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.q10XUuFrVlw8qYj1.JournalEntryPage.pHlopVD36uBfquJF]{Medium Armor}, @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.q10XUuFrVlw8qYj1.JournalEntryPage.X44Pl3A47cBj6yUt]{Heavy Armor}
@UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.nfEDSQG0DMBs7eGp]{Weapons}: @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.nfEDSQG0DMBs7eGp.JournalEntryPage.0OO6dvVBUM4XAluS]{Simple Weapon}, @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.nfEDSQG0DMBs7eGp.JournalEntryPage.MzJ8wA3QJOZDJ1El]{Martial Weapons}
Saving Throws: &Reference[Strength], &Reference[Constitution]
@UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.rv19GFzEa0nMTuAF]{Skills}: two of: &Reference[Acrobatics], &Reference[Animal Handling], &Reference[Athletics], &Reference[History], &Reference[Insight], &Reference[Intimidation], &Reference[Perception], and &Reference[Survival]

Items

You start with the following equipment, in addition to the equipment granted by your background:

  • @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-equipment.sgcCg8pGXKBu3f4S]{chain mail} -OR- @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-equipment.Item.jSi9ralAm7FzUQbH]{padded armor}, @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-equipment.Item.u9OIgbETWimkeEx5]{longbow}, and 20 @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-equipment.Item.wQOk5JAcJ8lEC9b3]{arrows}
  • a @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-equipment.Item.ZOyejSDAVAH74Z4u]{longsword} and a @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-equipment.Item.AENiTUeluTRiFzRz]{large shield} -OR- any @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.nfEDSQG0DMBs7eGp.JournalEntryPage.0mJgDHc69dAZQtRr#simple-weapon]{weapon} and a @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-equipment.Item.AENiTUeluTRiFzRz]{large shield} -OR- any two @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.nfEDSQG0DMBs7eGp.JournalEntryPage.0mJgDHc69dAZQtRr#simple-weapon]{weapons}
  • a @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-equipment.Item.wPcrbw6GTNb9ZYvp]{light crossbow} and 20 bolts -OR- two @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-equipment.Item.rIzJTl2bsFVDNji3]{handaxes}
  • a dungeoneer's pack -OR- an explorer's pack

Multiclass Characters

Instead of leveling up in your original class, you can take a fighter level when you level up. When you do, you gain only a portion of what first level fighters gain.

Multiclassing Ability Score Requirements

Taking levels in several classes requires exceptional ability. You must meet the multiclassing ability score requirements for both your original class and the class you are multiclassing into.

For fighters you must have:

  • Either Strength: 14 or Dexterity: 14

Hit Points

Per Level: 1d10 (or 6) + Constitution Modifier
Hit Dice: 1d10 per fighter level

Proficiencies

@UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.q10XUuFrVlw8qYj1]{Armor}: @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.q10XUuFrVlw8qYj1.JournalEntryPage.4ZoOlPhNDk46Vvnr]{Light Armor}, @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.q10XUuFrVlw8qYj1.JournalEntryPage.pHlopVD36uBfquJF]{Medium Armor}, @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.q10XUuFrVlw8qYj1.JournalEntryPage.X44Pl3A47cBj6yUt]{Heavy Armor}
@UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.nfEDSQG0DMBs7eGp]{Weapons}: @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.nfEDSQG0DMBs7eGp.JournalEntryPage.0OO6dvVBUM4XAluS]{Simple Weapon}, @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.nfEDSQG0DMBs7eGp.JournalEntryPage.MzJ8wA3QJOZDJ1El]{Martial Weapons}

Fighter Advancement

LevelProficiency BonusFeatures

advancement.title: Fighting Style
advancement.hint: You adopt a particular style of fighting as your specialty. Choose one of the following options from the appropriate class list. You can't take a Fighting Style option more than once, even if you later get to choose again.

advancement.title: Items
advancement.hint: Choose chain mail -OR- padded armor, longbow, and 20 arrows

advancement.title: Items
advancement.hint: Choose a longsword and a large shield -OR- any weapon and a large shield -OR- any two weapons

advancement.title: Items
advancement.hint: Choose a light crossbow -OR- two handaxes

advancement.title: Combat Maneuver
advancement.hint:
You learn one Combat Maneuver, as described on the Feats page.

You can use each maneuver a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus. When you finish a long rest, you regain all uses of your maneuvers.

advancement.title: Superior Ability
advancement.hint: You increase one ability score of your choice by 2, to a maximum of 22.

advancement.title: Feat
advancement.hint:
At this level and every level you gain an ability score improvement, you also gain a feat of your choice. You are eligible for general feats, monk feats, and combat maneuver feats by default.
                        You may be eligible for other feats, which you can drag from the appropriate compendium into this box below.
                        
                        Some feats have additional prerequisites. Check the description of a feat before choosing it.

advancement.title: Feat
advancement.hint: You gain a level 1 feat of your choice. You can choose from the feats available to all classes or choose a level 1 class-specific feat, if there is one available.​

advancement.title: Martial Archetype
advancement.hint:
You choose a martial archetype, which represents the specialized training and skills you develop that make you different from other fighters. Your Martial Archetype gives you new abilities at this level and at levels 6, 10, 14, and 18.
    
    Martial Archetypes published elsewhere are compatible with this version of the fighter class. For help converting a subclass to function with Elkan 5e, see the Elkan 5e Rules Compendium -> Help.
